page.title: 07SHIPYARD, PORTESSIE
page.content: MR. JAMES GRANT, FROM RATHVEN, WORKS AT HERD AND MCKENZIE'S SHIPYARD IN BUCKIE. HE IS A MARINE ENGINEER FOREMAN. THERE ARE 88 PEOPLE EMPLOYED AT HIS SHIPYARD. DIFFERENT SKILLS ARE NEEDED TO BUILD A BOAT. NEEDED ARE PAINTERS, ELECTICIANS, WELDERS, JOINERS, PLATERS, SHIPWRIGHTS, RIVETERS AND BLACKSMITHS. THE MOST TYPICAL BOAT BUILT IS THE SEINE NET FISHING BOAT. THE KEEL, STEM AND STERN POST ARE LAID FIRST. OAK FRAMES ARE FIXED TO THE KEEL THEN LARCH PLANKS ARE FIXED TO THE FRAMES. IN JUNE 1985, THERE ARE SEVEN BOATS ON THE SLIP. ONE OF THEM IS THE MORNING PRINCE. A NEW BOAT COSTS AN AVERAGE OF Â£500,000. {BY ANDREW MATHESON AND ROSS {SLATER.
